She has goats and chickens on the property but we couldn't see them this time of the year due to all of the wind and snow. She was nice enough to let our 3 dogs stay with us at no extra charge and they played with Flo. The home was cozy and vastly decorated, if you want to learn the history of the Gale's forefathers, there is a book on the chest in the living room. We hope to stop by when the weather is better. We highly recommend staying here to get that farm and country feel.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Gale's listing is wonderful, as a host she's wonderful, very friendly, very welcoming. I was excited also to have the chance to meet Flo her dog.
Everything involving the host, the property and the experience of sharing a slice of life with Gale was wonderful. There was a big negative though, me.
I've stayed at many Airbnbs in the past, we almost always bring our dogs. Up until recently we've always traveled with our big popup kennel. A few months ago I decided that our dogs never showed any destructive traits so it was a waste of space in our tight little jeep setup. As we were leaving my girlfriend said "are you sure you don't want to bring the kennel" I said "nope, they're all good, we trust them".
In hindsight that was very dumb, but also against the rules. While not mentioned in Gale's house rules page in the description it does clearly state that dogs aren't to be left alone in the cottage unless in a kennel. I missed that completely. The first night was fine, the second day, wasn't. I'm guessing they were startled by something outside, what it was doesn't really matter but our pups (I think I know which one) damaged the blinds inside of the cottage. We got the call as we were heading into Sioux Falls, Gale reminded me of the kennel policy (again which I completely overlooked). She showed lenience on us though as she allowed them to stay in the mud room, which wasn't ideal for any of us but it was an option that excused me from finding another place to stay or a new kennel. Everything else went well and as far as I can say no other hitches. My own hubris caused a dark cloud over the trip though. Sometimes we need to stop, and listen to our partners and do a reality check. I won't forget this one. Thanks Gale, I hope we're able to stay with you again sometime, kennel in tow.

review_text:
This was the most unique and cute Airbnb!!
The cottage was super comfy and quiet. We were traveling with our 2 labs and they were able to roam the farm and check out the chickens and goats!
Gale greeted us upon arrival (and made some great recommendations for the rest of our road trip), but gave us free reign of the farm to explore (plenty of privacy). We also had fresh cookies in the kitchen upon arrival (yum)!
Gale quietly dropped breakfast off the next morning at the door (at the time we specified). It was the cutest setup but was also an AMAZING breakfast.
We only stayed one night, but this was the perfect stop on our long road trip. Beds were comfortable and we had all amenities needed; full kitchen with fridge and microwave, shower with toiletries, etc.
There is no tv, but we didnâ€™t need it. Exploring the farm was fun and the cottage also has puzzles/cards if you are traveling with kids.
I would absolutely recommend Galeâ€™s cottage and will be staying again when we road trip through there in the future!

The goats and chickens are steps away, the area is incredibly quiet, and the space is incredibly comfortable. No fenced yard but I'd guess they'd be okay with off-leash pets if you asked (mine are runners so didn't try). Memory foam mattress that is medium firm, A/C worked on a pretty hot SD weekend. The fact that breakfast is included in your stay (and the breakfast is superb) is amazing. Definitely recommend, definitely would stay again.

review_text: We chose Kateâ€™s Cottage as the location for our wedding anniversary for many reasons and they all proved to be true and good. First, we wanted to â€œget away from it all.â€ The cottage is on an old farmstead in a rural area typical of what one would imagine South Dakota to be like, a cluster of buildings surrounded by a windbreak in a sea of acres and acres of farmland. Coyotes were howling at sundown on our first night and then the most wonderful quiet ever came with the darkness. There was a CD player with a little selection of music and we played the flute CD and had a glass of wine while relaxing and talking in a most comfortable living room. Sleep was undisturbed and the bed very comfortable. Breakfast brought to our door (the second reason we chose this location) was the best treat of all! Gale asked about dietary preferences and fashioned two lovely and very hearty breakfasts for us that filled us so much that we didnâ€™t even need to eat lunch! We picked up a yummy Caseyâ€™s pizza the first night and brought our own food to be microwaved on the second night since we knew the weather was not going to be the best. The third reason we chose the cottage was because we wanted to bring our two little terriers with us. They just loved their little walks around the farm and snoozing near us in the warm cottage. We chose to visit a friend 35 minutes away in Sioux Falls for our outing on Saturday, but considered hiking in local state parks or visiting Vermillion. The quaintness of the cabin provided a setting that was super comfortable and private for a lovely weekend for us! Thanks, Gale, for being such a great host!

Kris was also very responsive to any questions.

Stephanie was a wonderful host- proactive communication, wonderful guidebook with great local recommendations, made sure we were able to get all settled in with no issues, and checked in periodically throughout our stay to make sure we didnâ€™t need anything or have any questions.
The tiny house was also amazing. It was clean, had all the amenities you could ask for and more (the heated floors were my personal favorite), and just adorable. We were a little nervous knowing there were other houses near the property but we didnâ€™t see anyone the whole time and there was a partial privacy fence that covered the view between the tiny home and the house behind it. So that was a non-issue!
Per Stephanieâ€™s recommendations we visited Ponca State Park (I highly recommend checking it out), ate at Outlaw Pizza and stopped at B&S Trading Post for groceries. All of it was wonderful and the people were very friendly.
All in all it was a great place to stay and a fun little place to visit!

This place was 100% every bit of what I was looking for in a stress-free, mini-getaway - I can't say enough good things! The moment you step inside, it's obvious that Stephanie has given this little house so much love and attention! It's beautifully made and every inch feels like it was crafted for comfort. The compactness of it actually made it really easy to settle in and still keep clean while there. Everything from the large porch to the big living-area windows to the loft skylight (probably my favorite thing!) made it easy to feel surrounded by nature, whether outside or inside. And there are so many options for cooking and eating - honestly, makes you want to try a little bit of everything.
The property too has the kind of views you could just sit and enjoy again and again. And Stephanie herself was great - super friendly and it was obvious from the start that she really was as available as she promised and more than willing to make sure it was great experience. Thank you!

,
Â·
Group trip
review_text: A group of us rented Kary's home for a weekend snow goose hunt. The location was absolutely perfect as it ended up being ~15 miles from where we were hunting. Being out in the country, we were able to sit outside and watch thousands of birds during migration. The home was very comfortable, with enough room for our group to sit and visit in the evenings. Having access to the clean garage was extremely helpful with all of our gear! I slept in the downstairs Georgia room and it was one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on. There was enough space in the home to allow for our group to not feel crowded or rushed. Kary was very accommodating and between his messages and the notebook at the house with instructions, everything was very convenient. No complaints in the least bit and hope to stay here again in the future!

Check in/out was a breeze. And the welcoming cheese/crackers/wine was a thoughtful touch.
The home is comfortable and clean with a well equipped kitchen. We cooked several meals to help save the money and tedium of eating out. The beds were comfortable, and extra blankets were nice to have in the basement rooms.
It was a nice "home base" for our trip, and we highly recommend Kary and his place for anyone thinking of visiting/staying in the area. You can't go wrong here.

Group trip
review_text: My husband, mother-in-law, brother-in-law, and I stayed together in order to attend a funeral in nearby Yankton. The host and home exceeded our expectations. The host was friendly and quick to answer emails, check in was a breeze, and the binder with restaurant menus, ammenities was helpful. The downtown area was only a couple of blocks away, easily within walking distance. The house was immaculate and showcased modern decor with a few eclectic pieces. There were board games to play, an ottoman filled with fuzzy blankets to snuggle up with on the couch and a huge TV, all of which gave a warm, comfortable, homey feel. We each had our own spacious bedroom with comfortable beds and pillows; the closets were huge with plenty of hangers provided; the biggest bonus was each of the three bedrooms having an ensuite. It allowed for all of us getting ready in the morning a breeze. The only downside was that we couldn't stay longer to enjoy this beautiful home. We hope to stay again!

review_text: If you are looking for a peaceful place to stay in this area, look no further! Communication was great and it was wonderful to have our own space, versus a hotel or houses close together. We loved being in the country for our stay, but you do need to be prepared for the remote location and dirt roads. There are a couple of towns pretty close by, so not too inconveinent. We were in town to attend graduation in Vermillion, the drive was fairly easy back and forth from Vermillion. The cabin has everything you need, very thoughful hosts. The shower is very small and would not be comfortable for very large people. We are average height and weight, so we had no trouble. The beds may also not be preferred by large/tall people. I'm 5'6 and my husband is 5'10, we have no trouble. If you need a peaceful place to stay while in this area, we receommend this cottage and would certainly stay again!

name: Karrie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: After going down a beautiful and scenic (and very dusty) road off the main highway, pulling into the cottage's driveway and taking everything in is an experience I hope you won't miss. The immediate quiet falls on you. Then, one by one, as if nature is a symphony, you hear the wind through the trees, birds singing, crickets cricking and the far off corn fields corning (yes, that's a word!). The daisy blanketed cottage grounds are a delight and the inside is just as fitting. We arrived and stayed for ten days during an extreme heat wave and we were all very comfortable. The cottage kitchen was not only well equipped with all you need but with equipment that worked well. Between the air conditioner and fans in every room, the house stayed cool (which was good for us as we acclimated back to the Midwest heat and humidity). Beds were comfy with plenty of pillows and linens. Our kids loved camping on the living room floor watching DVDs. Mary Ellen had excellent communication, instructions and suggestions for outings. My only suggestion would be to make sure you use the bug spray at night when going out. And you'll want to go out at night and see the expansive starry sky and LIGHTNING BUGS and hear the whippoorwills!

I want to come back!

review_text: I stayed in the renovated chicken coop! the studio apartment like feel was very cozy and comfy. I personally didn't mind sharing a community bathhouse that wasn't attached to the stay but that's just me. the bathhouse was nicely furnished and felt like a mini hotel lol. The plot of land this place is on is gorgeous, wide open horizons for the sunset. They let me light a fire in the pit, I sat under the full moon and played guitar, dreams do come true lol. just stayed for one night, passing thru coming home from a roadtrip, and honestly am very glad I choose this place over a local hotel. it was fun, exciting, peaceful, rejuvenated the soul, and left me ready for my drive the next day. this air bnb left me with cool memories to finish off my roadtrip! Definitely staying here again someday!

name: Lizz
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2022
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
First of all, this property was GORGEOUS. There was so much to explore and see, from the gazebo to the balcony of the reception hall to the corn crib swings and on! The twinkle lights strung throughout the grounds added a magical (and useful!) element to the stay.
To all people that will book in the future (which you definitely should)- remember that you will be staying in a refurbished chicken coop. There will be some spiders/flies/other random bugs in various nooks and crannies of the place. Do not come expecting your stay to be comparable to one at The Ritz. Embrace the eccentric and absolutely adorable stay for what it is. Outside, under the stars, in the fields, beneath the trees.
Kelley was a dream of a host. She was quick to respond and very informative. She provided cereal, milk, orange juice, and a gallon of water in the kitchen, as well as plastic cutlery, paper towels, garbage bags, etc. She also had chocolates and little snack pastries in the coop for us upon arrival.
I cannot stress how beautiful and expansive the grounds of this property are. I would highly recommend the chicken coop to anyone and everyone.

name: Taia
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Noreen is so incredibly kind and accommodating. We arrived pretty late into the evening on our check-in day, and she took the time to show us around, helping us feel safe and comfortable on the ranch. We stayed in the chicken coop, which was cozy and inviting after a long drive. The sinks and toilets are a short walk across their driveway (as stated on the listing), but this was a non-issue for us since the weather was very warm while we stayed and their light sensors turned on whenever we needed to head that direction at night. Although this was essentially glamping, there are plenty of outlets for lighting and charging phones/electronics if needed. We watched movies, relaxed, and were able to make cereal for breakfast (provided by Noreen). We even asked for extra fans to stay cooler at night. There is a window AC unit that helped a ton, but we're just not used to the humidity we experienced! Noreen took care of that and any other request we reached out for. My kids absolutely loved the ranch, chicken coop, and yard games... calling it their favorite part of our trip! The ranch location is just a short drive to Vermillion if you happen to be headed to USD like we were. Also, if you're lucky to stay on the property, you might get to say hello to Noreen's sweet pets Freckles and Moo. Thank you again for the memories, we hope to return soon!

Loved my stay here. The hosts were very friendly and easy to communicate with, greeted me on arrival and let me know where everything was. The coop was as pictured and a lovely place to stay. The bathroom facilities are spacious and plenty. I did not miss having running water in the coop. The provided amenities were a nice touch, too. Note that the second bed in the coop is an air mattress on a frame. The first bed was very comfortable and easy to sleep on, medium firmness.
The property has some lovely shared spaces and would be great to hang out in. The hosts were also welcoming to my dog, which I very much appreciated!

Stayed one night
review_text:
Kelly's Farm is a fantastic and serene place. It is right off the road so easy to access.
The farm itself is very big and therefore lot of open places to explore. Kelly has decorated a section of the farm very well, sitting in that Gazebo with shade over you and the birds chirping around you is very peaceful.
We stayed in the Chicken Coop, and it is literally that, a remodeled coop.
Therefore, the cleanliness takes a hit inside the room. The blankets/throws have lot of dust in it, the bed/mattress too is not in the greatest condition.
Also, given that the restroom is a short walk away from the coop, for me to say this is good value the per night price needs to further drop a little bit to say $35-$40.
But in the mornings one will realize how beautiful the place is, we loved the place apart from a few minor issues mentioned above.

review_text:
We love Airbnbâ€™s for the room, comfort, and privacy. This one definitely has privacy and comfort! The yards are full of over grown plants - in a good way. They shelter the property so you feel like you are in an oasis. Private back sitting area, small but private. The front porch was the place to hang outside. The bathroom is small and the only access is through two of the bedrooms but that did not pose an issue for our family of 4.
Hosts were SUPER responsive! Check in was a breeze. We had everything we needed at the house for the week.
When we checked in the AC was on (was a hot humid day so we were very thankful!) and they left the lights on for us ğŸ˜Š
We figured only one TV (living room) so had packed another for one of the kids Xbox. But with all the trips we took - Sioux City and Sioux Falls, we were only there in the evenings.
Which to another point - Verm is nicely centrally located to go for day trips to two large cities!

name: Jeff
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2023
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: This is great spot to stay for any visit to Vermillion. The decor was interesting, there were plenty of dishes, spices and cooking necessities in the kitchen, great selection of books to read, a desk for work, a large gathering table, and the privacy of 3 sleeping areas. It has one of Vermillion's beautiful iconic town lamp posts out front, a morning porch to sit on for coffee, Frnch Press and a very private back yard with flowers and plantings. Kitchen was clean, bathrooms were clean, and linens and big towels were just fine, a/c worked very well. This is a good examples of a family house being successfully turned into a very usable guest house. Hoping to come back. Loved the regional Sioux inspired art to enjoy and the fresh paint job throughout. The greenery in the back garden and off street parking gave us privacy and a few blooms to enjoy. Great for a family stay or couple's retreat with full kitchen, university event stay. They home is in a prime yet quiet spot.

name: Melissa
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
September 2021
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text:
This place was nicely in the countryside, quiet, and remote.
While denoted as "dogs allowed" it definitely should not be considered "dog friendly". Inside the cottage, thankfully we spotted four Advils under the coffee table. Ibuprofen, as you may know, is toxic to dogs. Additionally, scattered on the grounds of the property was not only trash (paper plates, empty water bottles and soda cans), but also wrapped and unwrapped chocolate candies, which as you might also know, is toxic to dogs.
The fridge included an opened bottle of milk, which, while in date, also might've been chugged from some unknown previous tenant during a pandemic. No, thanks.
The bathroom had no hand-towels, but only washcloths well beyond their useful life to dry your hands.
The Ibuprofen on the rug, random dead insects and general dust and dead/dying plants leads us to think the cottage is not deeply cleaned very regularly.
There was a distinct lack of side-tables, so we pulled stools around to have a place to put our cocktails. The pallet-wood coffee table, though, was pretty unusable as the gaping slots of pallets do not work swimmingly well to hold beverages, remote controls, or apparently Advil.
Additionally, we will be rinsing glitter off ourselves and our dog-bed for the next several months, as it's clear some sort of glitter bomb had exploded in the bedroom, and had not been vacuumed up since The Event.
Additionally, do know if you do book this cottage, Google Maps will send you about 100 yards beyond the entrance of the Blue Tin Ranch, into a corn field. The gate is marked "BTR" and well illuminated with lights.

Both Kea and Gabe were quick to respond to any inquiries/requests we had.
Very easy to check in and out. Quick walk to a delightful coffee shop, restaurants, movie theater, library, etc.
Quiet, beautiful neighborhood.

review_text:
One year later, our second "honeymoon" stay at Kea Sophie's vintage house was very much the same as the first, except this time we were joined by our son and two grandchildren from California...and a notable fresh coat of paint has freshened up the interior. Involving family gatherings, both trips to Vermillion were charged and meaningful, and "glamping" at this marvelous location surely served to ramp up those visits. Location, accessibility, amenities, convenience, all things favorable are adequately promoted in the listing, but the embracing ambiance and intangibles must be experienced. This house was built 80 years before Patricia and I were married for heaven's sake, and you can't buy this kind of domestic charm, you have to live it...and preserve it.
Thanks Kea Sophie and Gabriel for doing your thing, so we could do ours...

name: James

Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2022
,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: Sometimes the line seems to blur between the enthusiasm a visit generates and the housing that allows all the generous features of the away-from-home adventure to meld, but I am very clear minded about the salient features of host Kea Sophie and Gabriel's Airbnb; Patricia and I thrived there and our experiences in Vermillion were greatly enhanced by virtue of staying in such a such a curiously warm and charming house nestled in a neighborhood that at once felt familiar and friendly. If one of your things is peace and quiet, I can only report that the loudest noise I heard during our week's stay was the sound of my head hitting the pillow on a very comfortable bed. Clean? Sure. Amply stocked. Yes. Convenience? On foot, two zigs and a zag get you to the bountiful yet quaint historic main street, and 30 cents worth of gas will take you to either the franchise strip or all things University of South Dakota, depending on your bent...and back. Easy access and communication? Of course. But these aspects seem to pale in comparison to the house's character. It is an old house that has been updated just enough to maintain the integrity and grace that comes with age. It has a generous lived-in feel and an assortment of curious furnishings, each iconic, enriching, from its own era with a story to tell. Reservations about our stay? None, save this...I suspect it will be increasingly difficult to book this marvelous mini mansion as time goes on.
